page.title: 08BUILDINGS IN MILDENHALL
page.content: Mildenhall is a small village. There is a main road running through it on which are situated an old{pub}covered with ivy and a modern{village hall} which is in a bad state of repair. The River Kennet which flows through the village provides a very good fishing area and supports a{trout farm.}The only shop in the village is the modern {Post Office}which also serves as a general stores. Mildenhall has an old {Church}(the earliest part is Saxon) around which are the oldest buildings in the village. Many of the private { {houses}are timber framed, have leaded windows and thatched roofs. Most of the oldest houses have been restored. However there are also many modern houses which shows that the village is growing. There is a row of council houses. The village is set in a valley and surrounded by farmland.
